text:
571 to 555 Grand Concourse, north of, adjoining, and at the N. W. corner of E. 149th Street, showing several buildings that were later demolished when the thoroughfare was widened.

May 16, 1928

P. L. Sperr
title: Bronx: Grand Concourse - 149th Street (East)

text:
Grand Concourse, east side, north from (No. 472) and across E. 149th Street. Shown, under construction, at E. 149th Street is a new United States Post Office.

July 7, 1936

P. L. Sperr
title: Bronx: Grand Concourse - 149th Street (East)

text:
Grand Concourse, north from E. 149th Street, showing the thoroughfare being widened on the west side. A number of old tenements were razed and several taxpayers were erected on the new zoning line. In the background is the Bronx County Court House.

June 9, 1940

P. L. Sperr
title: Bronx: Grand Concourse - 149th Street (East)

text:
1. Grand Concourse from 149th St.
P.L. Sperr, photographer

2. 149th St. & Grand Concourse, n.w. cor.
P.L. Sperr, photographer
April 30, 1941
title: Bronx: Grand Concourse - 149th Street

text:
